subject: Keyboard Layouts
msgSnippet: Over on the bulletin board, jayson thought things d be better if there were more keyboard layouts. I agree, and since maintaining keyboard layouts is one of
messageBody:
Over on the bulletin board, jayson thought things'd be better if there were more keyboard layouts. I agree, and since maintaining keyboard layouts is one of the things I do, I figured I could pitch in a bit.


Thing is, I don't want to maintain umpteen semi-QWERTY layouts — one should be enough.


Are there any preexisting layouts that:

  • don't clobber punctuation (if it's on a US keyboard, it should be on a Quikscript one)
  • have both curved and angled parentheses
  • don't have precomposed er/ar/ju/etc. ligatures?
Also: If you're using a keyboard layout that might be slightly different (because it's part of a font you use), would you be wiling to switch if it meant you could use any font that has PUA Unicode characters? (Most fonts I've seen have Unicode variants.)
